column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Colour Your Computer
#Text=Computers come in a variety of sizes and shapes , as well as color .
#Text=But suppose the computer you wanted did n't come in the color you wanted , or you could n't find the right color case for your custom computer ?
#Text=Well , here 's how you can recolor your computer , with information about what to do in disassembling it for those who are not computer savvy !
#Text=( If you know what you 're doing , you do n't have to read all that )
#Text=Steps
#Text=Taking Your Computer Apart
#Text=First , disconnect all cables in the back of your computer .
#Text=Make sure there are no adapters , wireless antennae , or flash drives in the back of it .
#Text=Open up the computer case and CAREFULLY remove all of the hardware .
#Text=Start by unplugging all of the colorful cables from everything they are connected to .
#Text=Make note of where they were connected , take a picture if you need to to aide you in rebuilding the computer .
#Text=Now remove the thin , ribbon-like cables from all of the drives ( rectangular things ) and motherboard ( The large board in the middle ) .
#Text=Get a screwdriver and start removing all of the screws inside , except for the ones on the big card in the middle .
#Text=Make sure you mark each screw on a paper to show you where it goes !
#Text=Pull out the square things , called disk drives .
#Text=Push them from the inside outward towards the front of the computer .
#Text=Start with the familiar drives ( CD , DVD , Floppy ) .
#Text=Now move down to the hard disk(s) ( The ones not sticking out of the front to put something in ) and pull them out .
#Text=Assuming that you have removed ALL screws ( except for the ones attaching the motherboard , or big one ) , start removing the small green cards .
#Text=Store them in a safe place , and be careful with them !
#Text=Remove the fans .
#Text=Pull them out ( it should be easy without screws , unscrew them now if you have n't ! )
#Text=gently and unplug them from the colorful cables .
#Text=Now it 's time to remove the motherboard .
#Text=The screws that you did n't remove should now be removed , and the board will be easy to take out .
#Text=Be sure not to drop anything that 's on it like the CMOS battery !
#Text=Be very careful with the motherboard , since it is the real computer out of all that other crap you took out !
#Text=Finally , remove that power supply , the one with the colorful cables coming out .
#Text=Unscrew it and take it out .
#Text=Painting the Case
#Text=Take your computer case and place it on newspaper outside .
#Text=Make sure there is NO hardware inside , and that it is completely taken apart .
#Text=Cover up the parts you do n't want to paint with painter 's tape and paper that paint wo n't bleed through .
#Text=BE ABSOLUTELY SURE that you cover up the interior of the case so you do n't paint it !
#Text=Also , for safety , make sure there are no drive bays inside ( metal things that hold the drives in ) .
#Text=If you have n't removed those , remove them now .
#Text=Paint the main case first ( DON'T PAINT THE BACK ! ) .
#Text=Then paint the sides that came off , then the top that came off .
#Text=No need to paint the bottom , and you probably should n't paint that either .
#Text=Wait a few hours , preferably 24 , before moving on to the next step .
#Text=Allow them to dry in the sun .
#Text=Rebuilding the computer
#Text=First , put back the drive bays .
#Text=Those are the metal things that hold the case together .
#Text=Put back the power supply .
#Text=Put back the motherboard , and screw it back in .
#Text=Put back the sound and graphics card , modem/Ethernet/wireless card , microphone card , etc. back exactly where they were .
#Text=These are the little green cards you removed .
#Text=Put back the memory ( if you removed it ) .
#Text=Put back the drives .
#Text=Plug in the power cables to everything EXACTLY the way they were .
#Text=Look at the picture you took earlier if you took one .
#Text=Plug the drives in to the motherboard using the ribbon cables .
#Text=Make sure to put them back in the right orientation !
#Text=Plug your computer in to the wall , and power it on to see if it boots .
#Text=If it beeps over and over again , or does n't power on , unplug it and check your work .
#Text=Try flipping the IDE cables over on both sides ( the cables that connect the CD , DVD , and Hard Drive to the motherboard ) , or the floppy cable .
#Text=Once it sounds like it does on boot up , hook it up to the monitor , keyboard , mouse , and whatever else you have !
#Text=Congrats , you painted your computer case !
#Text=Tips
#Text=Get a friend who knows computers well to help you take it apart and put it back together .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=This can VOID YOUR WARRANTY if your computer is under one !
#Text=If you do n't feel comfortable taking parts out of your computer or do n't know half of what this article says , do n't take your computer apart .
#Text=It may be expensive to fix .
#Text=NEVER attempt to open the ATX Power Supply !
